comments:
while starting eclipse I20061212-0010 I got the following error in the error log...sorry no steps to reproduce.

java.lang.ClassCastException: gnu.javax.crypto.jce.DiffieHellmanImpl cannot be cast to javax.crypto.KeyAgreementSpi
at javax.crypto.KeyAgreement.getInstance(KeyAgreement.java:129)
at com.jcraft.jsch.jce.DH.init(Unknown Source)
at com.jcraft.jsch.DHG1.init(Unknown Source)
at com.jcraft.jsch.Session.receive_kexinit(Unknown Source)
at com.jcraft.jsch.Session.connect(Unknown Source)
at com.jcraft.jsch.Session.connect(Unknown Source)
at org.eclipse.team.internal.ccvs.ssh2.JSchSession.createSession(JSchSession.java:483)
at org.eclipse.team.internal.ccvs.ssh2.JSchSession.getSession(JSchSession.java:446)
at org.eclipse.team.internal.ccvs.ssh2.CVSSSH2ServerConnection.internalOpen(CVSSSH2ServerConnection.java:122)
at org.eclipse.team.internal.ccvs.ssh2.CVSSSH2ServerConnection.open(CVSSSH2ServerConnection.java:107)
at org.eclipse.team.internal.ccvs.core.connection.Connection.open(Connection.java:131)
at org.eclipse.team.internal.ccvs.core.connection.CVSRepositoryLocation.createConnection(CVSRepositoryLocation.java:539)
at org.eclipse.team.internal.ccvs.core.connection.CVSRepositoryLocation.openConnection(CVSRepositoryLocation.java:780)
at org.eclipse.team.internal.ccvs.core.client.Session.open(Session.java:159)
at org.eclipse.team.internal.ccvs.ui.operations.SingleCommandOperation.execute(SingleCommandOperation.java:40)
at org.eclipse.team.internal.ccvs.ui.operations.RepositoryProviderOperation.execute(RepositoryProviderOperation.java:280)
at org.eclipse.team.internal.ccvs.ui.operations.SingleCommandOperation.execute(SingleCommandOperation.java:66)
at org.eclipse.team.internal.ccvs.ui.operations.RepositoryProviderOperation.execute(RepositoryProviderOperation.java:256)
at org.eclipse.team.internal.ccvs.ui.operations.RepositoryProviderOperation.execute(RepositoryProviderOperation.java:210)
at org.eclipse.team.internal.ccvs.ui.operations.CVSOperation.run(CVSOperation.java:81)
at org.eclipse.team.internal.ui.actions.JobRunnableContext.run(JobRunnableContext.java:144)
at org.eclipse.team.internal.ui.actions.JobRunnableContext$ResourceJob.runInWorkspace(JobRunnableContext.java:72)
at org.eclipse.core.internal.resources.InternalWorkspaceJob.run(InternalWorkspaceJob.java:38)
at org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.Worker.run(Worker.java:58)

kernel version: Linux dual 2.6.18-1.2849.fc6 #1 SMP Fri Nov 10 12:36:14 EST 2006 i686 athlon i386 GNU/Linux
gtk version: gtk2-2.10.4-6.fc6

jre: sun 1.5.0_10
Moving to REMIND awaiting response from reporter

It does not happen on 3.2, nor does it appear to be happeing on the 3.3M4 release.

I am not using gcj, it is not installed on my machine.

output from your program:

SunJCE version 1.5

(In reply to comment #3)
> It does not happen on 3.2, nor does it appear to be happeing on the 3.3M4
> release.
> I am not using gcj, it is not installed on my machine.

If your 'java.security' file included in Sun's JRE has not pointed to 
GNU-crypto provider, such a message like 'gnu.javax.crypto.jce.DiffieHellmanImpl' should not be appeared.

If you really do not touch 'java.security' file, I20061212-0010 may
install JCE provider internally and other GNU/Linux users should have
the same problem.
From the comments, it does not appear that this is still an issue. If my interpretation is incorrect, please reopen.
